movie_title: The murderous medieval king who inspired "Macbeth" - Benjamin Hudson
introduction: Dig into the history that inspired Shakespeare’s tragedy, “Macbeth,” and find out just how much of t

vocabulary.example: The prophecies made by the witches in 'Macbeth' influenced the actions of the main characters.

vocabulary.definition: extreme and irrational distrust of others
vocabulary.example: Macbeth's paranoia after committing regicide led to his downfall.

vocabulary.definition: a person who takes a position of power by force or illegal means
vocabulary.example: Malcolm Canmore led a successful raid against the usurper Macbethad.
In 'Macbeth', an arboreal army approaches Macbeth's castle.
John of Fordun, a Scottish cleric, wrote a history of Scotland incorporating Macbethad's rule.

vocabulary.definition: the suppression or prohibition of any parts of books, films, news, etc. that are considered obscene, politically unacceptable, or a threat to security
vocabulary.example: Shakespeare may have included the witches in 'Macbeth' as a way to rebel against censorship of witchy plays.
